bibdata.title: IEEE Guide for the Application of Neutral Grounding in Electrical Utility Systems--Part I: Introduction
Redline
IEEE Guide for the Application of Neutral Grounding in Electrical Utility Systems--Part I: Introduction - Redline
bibdata.docidentifier: IEEE Std C62.92.1-2016 (Revision of IEEE Std C62.92.1-2000) - Redline

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

bibdata.abstract: The application of neutral grounding to three-phase electrical utility systems is described in this guide. It is Part 1 of the IEEE C62.92 series of guides for neutral grounding. This guide presents basic considerations of the selection of neutral grounding parameters that will provide for the control of overvoltage and ground-fault current on all parts of three-phase electrical utility systems rated greater than 1000 V.

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
